title: Spice container in the form of Harkness Tower at Yale University
marks:
Signature, Inscription and Edition

see Signed on bottom, incised: [J. Marrow / STERLING / 27/100
text: Spice boxes are an important element of the Havdalah ceremony that closes the Sabbath. Buildings and towers are a traditional form for spice boxes.  Marrow's is a stylized version of the neo-Gothic Harkness Tower, the centerpiece of the Memorial Quadrangle at Yale University.
description: tower form; spire at each corner; removable top section has thin spires extending upward
creditline: Gift of Daniel and Joanna S. Rose
